title: Density Formula
text: Density is mass per unit volume, and the formula is $$p=\frac{m}{v}$$ where $$p$$ is the density, $$m$$ is the mass, and v is the volume occupied by the substance.

title: Identify the Densities of the Constituents
text: We take the density of gold p_gold=19.32g/cm³, the density of silver p_silver=10.1g/cm³, and the density of copper p_copper=8.8g/cm³.

title: Formula for the Weighted Average Density
text: The weighted average density is $$p_{mix}=\frac{m_g}{M} p_{gold}+\frac{m_s}{M} p_{silver}+\frac{m_c}{M} p_{copper}$$, where M is the total mass and $$m_g$$, $$m_s$$, $$m_c$$ are the masses of gold, silver, and copper.

title: Calculate the Weighted Average Density
text: The mass fractions are provided: $$\frac{18}{24}$$ for gold, $$\frac{5}{24}$$ for silver, and $$\frac{1}{24}$$ for copper. Now plug in the values and calculate the weighted average density $$p_{mix}$$.
